Divine Creator.quote: In the beginning, Brahma created the universe through tapas (meditation). (Mundaka Upanishad 1.1.8)

Cosmic Origin.quote: From the golden egg (Hiranyagarbha), Brahma, the creator of the whole world, was born. (Rig Veda 10.121)

Creative Power.quote: Through his mind, Brahma created the Prajapatis, the lords of created beings. (Matsya Purana 3.27)

Divine Knowledge.quote: Brahma holds the four Vedas and is the source of all knowledge. (Brahma Purana 1.1)

Divine Time.quote: One day of Brahma equals a thousand yugas, and his night is of equal duration. (Bhagavad Gita 8.17)

Divine Manifestation.quote: From his mind came the moon, from his eyes the sun, from his mouth Indra and Agni. (Mundaka Upanishad 2.1.4)

Divine Wisdom.quote: Brahma first created the Vedas, which contain all knowledge of dharma. (Brahma Vaivarta Purana)

Divine Aspects.quote: Four-faced Brahma sees in all directions simultaneously, representing omniscience. (Shiva Purana)

Divine Vehicle.quote: Brahma travels on his divine swan, Hamsa, symbolizing perfect discrimination. (Brahmanda Purana)

Divine Abode.quote: Brahma resides in Brahmaloka, the highest of the material planets. (Vishnu Purana 1.3)

Divine Trinity.quote: Brahma creates, Vishnu preserves, and Shiva dissolves - the three aspects of the cosmic cycle. (Kurma Purana)

Divine Birth.quote: Brahma emerged from the lotus that grew from Vishnu's navel. (Padma Purana)

Divine Function.quote: As the creator, Brahma brings forth all species of life in the universe. (Brahma Purana)

Divine Day.quote: During Brahma's day the worlds come forth, at his night they are dissolved. (Bhagavad Gita 8.18)

Divine Consciousness.quote: From pure consciousness, Brahma creates the manifest universe. (Aitareya Upanishad 1.1)

Divine Order.quote: Brahma established the cosmic order (Rita) and the moral law (Dharma). (Rig Veda)

Divine Mind.quote: Through mental creation, Brahma manifested the primordial elements. (Vishnu Purana)

Divine Sons.quote: The mind-born sons of Brahma were the first teachers of humanity. (Srimad Bhagavatam 3.12)

Divine Tools.quote: With the elements as his tools, Brahma fashioned the universe. (Brahmanda Purana)

Divine Planning.quote: Before creation, Brahma contemplated how to create the worlds. (Matsya Purana)

Divine Energy.quote: Through his creative energy (shakti), Brahma manifests the cosmic egg. (Markandeya Purana)

Divine Cycles.quote: Creation and dissolution follow each other like day and night of Brahma. (Vishnu Purana)

Divine Authority.quote: Brahma received the authority to create from the Supreme Lord. (Srimad Bhagavatam)

Divine Blessing.quote: Brahma's grace bestows knowledge and creative power. (Brahma Vaivarta Purana)

Divine Speech.quote: From Brahma's mouths came the four Vedas, repositories of eternal wisdom. (Brahma Purana)

Divine Role.quote: As the creator, Brahma is the first teacher of all arts and sciences. (Padma Purana)

Divine Evolution.quote: Through Brahma, the unmanifest becomes manifest in stages. (Brahmanda Purana)

Divine Duration.quote: Brahma's lifespan is hundred years of his time scale. (Bhagavata Purana 3.11)

Divine Balance.quote: Brahma maintains the balance of creation through wisdom and power. (Shiva Purana)

Divine Universe.quote: The entire universe is contained within Brahma's egg. (Vishnu Purana 1.2)
